committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, Reserved Water and Resource Conservation
Subcommittee on Public Lands and National Parks

official_title: An act to provide for a study of grazing phaseout at Capitol Reef National Park, and for other purposes.

summary.as: Senate agreed to House amendment with amendment
summary.text: (Senate agreed to House amendments with an amendment) Requires the Secretary of the Interior to allow persons (or their heirs) holding grazing privileges on Federal lands within the Capitol Reef National Park in Utah, which will terminate before December 31, 1992, to retain such grazing privileges until December 31, 1994. Directs the Secretary, acting through the Director of the National Park Service, to contract with the National Academy of Sciences within 90 days after enactment of this Act for a study on the impacts of grazing in the Capitol Reef National Park. Requires that such study be transmitted by the National Academy of Sciences to specified congressional committees and to the Director of the National Park Service by January 1, 1992. Requires annual progress reports on the study, starting on January 1, 1984. Authorizes appropriations. Makes authority under this Act to enter into contracts or to make payments effective only to the extent and in such amounts as provided in advance in appropriations Acts.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Act establishing the Capitol Reef National Park in the State of Utah to provide for a grazing phaseout schedule, and for other purposes.
An act to provide for a study of grazing phaseout at Capitol Reef National Park, and for other purposes.
